monster_sea.title: [Game Design] Monster of the Sea
monster_sea.small_descr: To hunt or be hunted - that is the tide of this game!
monster_sea.description:
Monster of the Sea is an asymetrical video game, meant to be played by 4 to 5 players.

The game revolve around the whale hunting : one player will be playing as the whale, as the others will incarnate the hunters.

As the whale, you will have the choice to either flee from the hunters, or kill them all. Whilst the hunters have to challenge their teamplay to suceed in killing or capturing the whale.

Who is the real monster ?

You can get the rules here and the GDD here.

bringstar.title: [Game Design] Bring Star
bringstar.small_descr: A Global Game Jam project with transmission as its core theme
bringstar.description:
'You are a special agent who was shot in the oxygen tank while doing a crucial intel collection mission.
Now, you must send the terrifying results of your investigations to the HQ before you die out of oxygen... That means 5 minutes.'

In BringStar, you must transmit a capital information by using the satellite network BringStar. The thing is : you must configure every one of them!

As a creative constraint while doing this project in the Global Game Jam, we had to make our game began where the others end, that is (in our case) out of the display window.

You can get the GDD here.

a_light_in_dark.title: [Sound Design] A Light in the Dark
a_light_in_dark.small_descr: A game trailer about a fictional survival game in space in Unreal Engine 4
a_light_in_dark.description:
By making this trailer, we wanted to present a dark fantasy game. We choose an Alien vibe as we wanted to experiment with the feeling of 'fear' and 'unease'.

As a group project, I was in charge with the programation of the 'game' (mostly camera shaking and character movement), the filming / montage of the trailer and the sound design.

When composing the sound and music, I was attracted by the atmosphere that dark synth can bring, and goes with an ambiant soundscape type of music.

However, even though it didn't made it in the trailer, I would love to experiment with the gameplay idea of this fictional game, which is a scientist alone on a planet, with no other weapon than is biochemical knowledge to defend himself.

utsura-man.title: [Solo] Utsura-Man
utsura-man.small_descr: Pac-man mecanisms and environmental narration : that's this game.
utsura-man.description:
Narration in a pacman game is what I wanted to try when doing this production.

Combining the game mecanics (like collecting the points or the ghosts) with environemental narration, I tried to make the player wonders about its actions.

The theme of this game is drugs : and so I wanted the player to experiment the effects that drugs can have, like distortion of reality, paranoia or putting yourself in serious danger in order to obtain drugs.

jdr.title: [Game Design / Scenarist] Tabletop RPG scenario
jdr.small_descr: A Twine work on tabletop RPG
jdr.description:
With this project, I codified a way to manage my scenario as a Game Master along using Twine as a tool.

Structurally, the tool is about showing the most important informations, those that are useful 'gameplaywise', that is : the type of scene (action, narration, social, ...), the objective of the scene, what character(s) or what skill(s) should be in the spotlight, and the different choices possibles.

It indicates also how to set the tone of the scene with what music, or the description I should deliver

You can get the render here here and the Twine file here

ld_labyrinthe.title:
[Level Design]
Vertical Electronic Labyrinth
ld_labyrinthe.small_descr: Prototype of a vertical labyrinth with electronic printings
ld_labyrinthe.description:
'What could a labynrinth using electronic printings geometry could look like ?'
This is with this original idea that I started this level design prototype.

By further exploring the idea, I came with the thought that I wanted to add a cyberpunk theme to it : so the idea finally cames out as 'a cyberpunk city electronic printing labyrinth' (breath).

I was willing to explore also the vertical structure, as I have fall in love with levels such as Blighttown from Dark Soul, which I find wonderfully crafted.

fps.title: [Programer] First Project Shooter
fps.description:
This project had as goal to master the networking aspect along with the 3D aspect of Unity (World Building, Raycast, ...).

The result is a pretty rough game with no server (you need to make VLAN to actually play it), but functional.

enter_dungeon.title: [Solo] Enter the Dungeon!
enter_dungeon.small_descr: An exploration game made under Casio Graph 85
enter_dungeon.description:
With this game, I tried to achieve a sense of perspective (a 3D labyrinth) in a game exclusively in 2D due to the machine limitations, combined with procedurally generated dungeons.

I was inspired by old dungeon crawler games like Dungeon Master or Digital Devil Story : Megami Tensei.

While the game remain pretty simple, it gives the old school feeling of dungeon crawling, where you had to keep track of your whereabouts!

cv_motion.title: CV Motion Design
cv_motion.small_descr: Motion Design of my old Curriculum Vitae
cv_motion.description:
The most important thing that I had in mind when making this project was how all things were going to transition one after all.

I wanted it to be in a fluid manner, surprising, dynamic and entertaining while being coherent and not feeling forced.

In attempt to achieve this, I used the forms that the differents symbols I used had to either give form to the next symbol or by creating a narration to explain the apparition of the new symbol.
